instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage No Display
threads.message:
So i've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in today from a Macbook Air which was water damaged. Fixed the short on ppbus which was preventing it from turning on, it switches on now and works on external display but nothing on the internal screen. The LCD connector is clean and no sign of liquid there however Pin 3 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUXCH_C_P</SIGNAL> on J8500 is reading 8ohms to ground in resistance mode and 0.0002 in diode mode. Getting the same readings if I pull <RESISTOR>R8502</RESISTOR>. Pin 2 reads normal 0.290 in diode mode. 

Just wanted to check because I think this means cpu itself is internally broken and is not fixable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage No Display
threads.message: Dead CPU, directly connected to J8500...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage No Display
threads.message: Thought so thanks - they'll just have to use it on external monitor only then!
